commit_message:
Fix ovs/netns mounts for neutron agents

Don't mount netns or /run from host system. If we mount /run or /run/netns then
it leads to broken netns on a host system level. Also when we remove containers
those netns bind files remain. This aslo causes problems.

Adapts I37c0783de6d6264ccf73648a1d15b23fdc31ad99 authored-by
Aleksandr Didenko <adidenko@mirantis.com>

Related-bug: #1734333

Change-Id: I462b40744610eb95031809d04b4ecce0d82a6e19
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 2e3a91f58bb48d4e7ab88258fbd704975cf1c79c)

commit_message:
zuul: don't run puppet jobs when only patching requirements.txt

requirements.txt is only useful for reno jobs, we shouldn't run any
Puppet job when touching this file.

Change-Id: Ic7cb50b32ea947933ab11b0970904e7f1f226d66

Add use_journal option for logging configuration

This enables oslo.log to pass logging records to journald.

Change-Id: I0b233c452d16de16378c4ca61ef046419bb3f3dc

commit_message:
Add container action etcd api

Add container action and container action event etcd api.
In etcd, using action uuid and event uuid instead of id to
get the unique action or event.

Change-Id: Ia761f1a94cd2b54d371b30a7be02543a539c5cb4

subject: Switch to OSC module
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-16 01:17:26.000000000', 'files': ['senlin_dashboard/api/senlin.py'], 'message': 'Switch to OSC module

For now, we use client module of senlin command for API.
But senlin command retired and we need to use client module
for OSC to call API.
This patch switches client module from CLI to OSC to call API.

Change-Id: Ie942180e640aeda59d46b814d123dd385f82da47
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Switch to OSC module

For now, we use client module of senlin command for API.
But senlin command retired and we need to use client module
for OSC to call API.
This patch switches client module from CLI to OSC to call API.

Change-Id: Ie942180e640aeda59d46b814d123dd385f82da47

commit_message:
Create dedicated "apache" base profile

This profile has multiple purposes:
- group common httpd configurations/instructions
- correct a small issue with the "status" mod

Until now, only Horizon was specifically including this mode, and as
httpd wasn't listening on localhost, it wasn't in use at all.

With this commit, all API using apache will be able to provide the httpd
server status on 127.0.0.1/server-status.

Change-Id: If6d64f807c244d7e56852a67ac7dbad26c4c002f
Closes-Bug: 1724751
(cherry picked from commit ca7239a5dc047c2c0aa5f8dc52205594c97469d3)

subject: Replace virtualenv-tools by a script
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-15 14:15:00.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/nova_install.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': "Replace virtualenv-tools by a script

virtualenv-tools has a bug which gets triggered in gates: it can't
change the shebang of a virtualenv python bin/ files if they
were generated with a virtualenv script whose shebang ends with
python2 instead of python.

Because we can't modify virtualenv-tools, we use shell scripts
instead.

Change-Id: Iafa7b6d43291fde11a1a072ce624474712ec99eb
Partial-Bug: #1741634
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Replace virtualenv-tools by a script

virtualenv-tools has a bug which gets triggered in gates: it can't
change the shebang of a virtualenv python bin/ files if they
were generated with a virtualenv script whose shebang ends with
python2 instead of python.

Because we can't modify virtualenv-tools, we use shell scripts
instead.

Change-Id: Iafa7b6d43291fde11a1a072ce624474712ec99eb
Partial-Bug: #1741634

subject: Add a resource monitoring feature into the manager
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-02 13:56:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add a resource monitoring mechanism into the manager

This patch introduces a new notification.listener and manager.monitor
modules. The notification.listener module provides a Listener class
which listens to notification messages using the notification listener
of the oslo_messaging[1]. Topics to subscribe and sets of an event type
and a callback are supplied by resource plugins. These callbacks are
wrapped by a method of manager to manage leases and reservations.

The manager.monitor module provides *Monitor classes which provides a
monitoring feature for each type of monitoring. Currently, only the
NotificationMonitor which is called 'Push-based monitoring' in the
spec[2] is implemented. It monitors resources using the Listener class.

This patch also adds methods for monitoring into the base resource
plugin (the BasePlugin class). Actual implementations that overide
these methods will follows this patch.
Note that part of these methods of the host plugin is implemented as a
sample.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.messaging/latest/reference/notification_listener.html
[2] I5a6b87910636bb476b94f68caaf74da83dafb987

Partially Implements: blueprint resource-monitoring
Change-Id: Ib3191e8ba67a784c5b5d009519161a847e94d55a

", 'number': 4}, {'created': '2017-11-21 07:33:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add a resource monitoring feature into the manager

This patch adds a new manager.monitor and notification.listener modules.
The manager.monitor module provides the following two types of monitor
classes:

* NotificationMonitor: It detects resource failures by subscribing
  notifications and handles these failures.

* PollingMonitor: It detects resource failures by periodically calling
  APIs of other services like Nova and handles these failures.

The NotificationMonitor uses the Listener class of the
notification.listener module. It listens to notification messages by
using the notification listener of the oslo_messaging[1].
Topics to subscribe and sets of an event type and a callback are
supplied by resource plugins. These callbacks are wrapped by a method of
manager to manage statuses of leases and reservations.

The PollingMonitor launches a service which periodically calls APIs of
other services. These calls are also wrapped by a method of manager to
manage statuses of leases and reservations.

This patch also adds a base resource monitor plugin (the
BaseMonitorPlugin class). Actual implementations that inherit it will
follows this patch. Note that part of a monitoring plugin for the host
plugin is implemented as a sample.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.messaging/latest/reference/notification_listener.html

Partially Implements: blueprint resource-monitoring

commit_message:
Add a resource monitoring feature into the manager

This patch adds a new monitor module which provides the following two
types of monitor class:

* NotificationMonitor: It detects resource failures by subscribing
  notifications and handles these failures.

* PollingMonitor: It detects resource failures by periodically calling
  APIs of other services like Nova and handles these failures.

The NotificationMonitor listens to notification messages by using the
notification listener of the oslo_messaging[1]. Topics to subscribe and
sets of an event type and a callback are provided by resource monitor
plugins.

The PollingMonitor periodically calls APIs of other services. The actual
poll() method and a polling interval are provided by resource monitor
plugins.

This patch also adds a base resource monitor plugin (the
BaseMonitorPlugin class). Actual implementations that inherit it will
follows this patch. Note that part of a monitoring plugin for the host
plugin is implemented as a sample.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.messaging/latest/reference/notification_listener.html

Partially Implements: blueprint resource-monitoring
Change-Id: Ib3191e8ba67a784c5b5d009519161a847e94d55a

commit_message:
Remove the deprecated "giturl" option

From openstackdocstheme 1.18.0, valid Git URLs can be retrieved by
openstackdocstheme[1], we do not need giturl option anymore.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/532163

Change-Id: I1848f43d337d40248fce3f50554e4b5ba294396c

commit_message:
Change assert(Not)Equals to assert(Not)Equal

According to http://docs.python.org/2/library/unittest.html
assert(Not)Equals is a deprecated alias of assert(Not)Equal.

Change-Id: I4ffa86e117f9b3e4bb80cf38c7d6b3b30bcc6b3d
Closes-Bug: #1329757

commit_message:
Add missing log level argument to ocf_log calls

There are a few ocf_log calls introduced recently in the mysql-wss OCF
file to ease troubleshooting and debugging. But, due to the absence of
the log level argument, error entries, indicating the missing argument,
are started to appear in the logs.

As a solution, 'debug' log level is added to all these discriminated
ocf_log call occurances.

Closes-bug: 1666507
Closes-Bug: 1683647

Change-Id: I59fe68cf53d361d565e743dc10b014e122139cb3
Signed-off-by: Gabor Orosz <gabor.orosz@ericsson.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-15 14:16:18.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/sahara_install.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': "Replace virtualenv-tools by a script

virtualenv-tools has a bug which gets triggered in gates: it can't
change the shebang of a virtualenv python bin/ files if they
were generated with a virtualenv script whose shebang ends with
python2 instead of python.

Because we can't modify virtualenv-tools, we use shell scripts

Partial-Bug: #1741634
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Replace virtualenv-tools by a script

virtualenv-tools has a bug which gets triggered in gates: it can't
change the shebang of a virtualenv python bin/ files if they
were generated with a virtualenv script whose shebang ends with
python2 instead of python.

Because we can't modify virtualenv-tools, we use shell scripts
instead.

Change-Id: I5c8b8d102829e84179f94e10a7464008ac5753c4
Partial-Bug: #1741634

commit_message:
Replace virtualenv-tools by a script

virtualenv-tools has a bug which gets triggered in gates: it can't
change the shebang of a virtualenv python bin/ files if they
were generated with a virtualenv script whose shebang ends with
python2 instead of python.

Because we can't modify virtualenv-tools, we use shell scripts
instead.

Change-Id: I7351e9e7e842b6de4b3e841ee9e44b6b6c514522
Partial-Bug: #1741634

commit_message:
Add support for outputting role-specific parameters

It is possible to pass parameters only to a specific role by using an
environment with a <role name>Parameters dict.  This change adds support
for sample environments with such nested parameters.

Change-Id: I7eb91d4262013341fab733342ab313caf8cec118

OvsDpdkMemoryChannels parameter default value

This change is to update the memory channels parameter default
value in service yaml instead of environment yaml file.

Add new image for realtime computes

Adds an overcloud-realtime-compute image, that replaces the default kernel with
the realtime kernel.

commit_message:
Configure auth_uri for swift proxy explicitly without suffix

This is meant for backporting to pike, since in that version, swift
proxy is the only service left that's configured with keystone v2.0.
This fixes that.

Change-Id: I403868e36000abd10be756dcbdb4ce32700f3fec
Closes-Bug: #1742654

commit_message:
Add release 10.0 to release mappings

This adds a '10.0' entry to the release mappings -- used for
rolling upgrades.

This is part of the process for preparing for the 10.0 release
(https://docs.openstack.org/ironic/latest/contributor/releasing.html#things-to-do-before-releasing)

Change-Id: I157d77a231022d9c67d076163fb4aff91e830421

commit_message:
Updating for new sphinx docs jobs

There have been recent changes to how docs jobs are run under zuul [1].
This patch updates octavia-dashboard to be able to run under the new
zuul docs jobs.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508694/

Change-Id: I44f7ce2538de0ce76860a3a2b477751de322ab02

Change-Id: I12c1727c3ded13c381852334cb54e5e976154e98
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2017-12-21 16:29:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Setup ansible interface in devstack

- enable ansible deploy interface
- install Ansible version from driver-requirements.txt
- generate private SSH key to use by Ansible (if absent)
- add the public ssh key to the tinyipa image during (re)build

By default nodes are not enrolled with it, as they will be assigned this
driver/interface in standalone tests.
For local development, nodes can be enrolled by setting

  IRONIC_DEFAULT_DEPLOY_INTERFACE=ansible

in local.conf and enabling ansible deploy interface via

  IRONIC_ENABLED_DEPLOY_INTERFACES=*,ansible

Change-Id: I12c1727c3ded13c381852334cb54e5e976154e98

commit_message:
Setup ansible interface in devstack

- enable ansible deploy interface
- install Ansible version from driver-requirements.txt
- generate private SSH key to use by Ansible (if absent)
- add the public ssh key to the tinyipa image during (re)build

By default nodes are not enrolled with it, as they will be assigned this
driver/interface in standalone tests.
For local development, nodes can be enrolled by setting

  IRONIC_DEFAULT_DEPLOY_INTERFACE=ansible

in local.conf and enabling 'ansible' deploy interface in the
IRONIC_ENABLED_DEPLOY_INTERFACES variable.

Change-Id: I12c1727c3ded13c381852334cb54e5e976154e98

commit_message:
update best practices

- remove 'prior to ocata' conditions.
- remove shuffle_time_before_polling_task as it doesn't work in
reality and is being removed.
- add a note when to enable workload_partitioning of notification
agent

Change-Id: I44c030835de1517a3c067ab0632c09f4a5fe2f15
(cherry picked from commit be1fa8f840051be24e3c8cdd8a6a8e24bee81f3f)

subject: Remove obsolete code regarding predefined relationship names
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-15 12:02:17.000000000', 'files': ['vitrage/tests/unit/evaluator/template_validation/test_template_syntax_validator.py', 'vitrage/common/constants.py', 'vitrage/evaluator/template_validation/status_messages.py'], 'message': "Remove obsolete code regarding predefined relationship names

We used to have a restriction that only predefined relationship names
(e.g. contains/causes/on/etc.) could be used, but that's no longer the case.

I removed an obsolete error message and fixed a test that did not run at all.

Change-Id: I19cb9781c055c8393ef40013f785d081b629c0ff
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove obsolete code regarding predefined relationship names

We used to have a restriction that only predefined relationship names
(e.g. contains/causes/on/etc.) could be used, but that's no longer the case.

I removed an obsolete error message and fixed a test that did not run at all.

Change-Id: I19cb9781c055c8393ef40013f785d081b629c0ff

commit_message:
Fix log file nova-conductor service

The nova-conductor log file is not properly set on the puppet service.

This fix the path to the nova-conductor file

Closes-bug: #1742434

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-12 21:53:31.000000000', 'files': ['docker/services/cinder-volume.yaml'], 'message': 'Cinder containers: volume and env customizations

This patch will allow custom volume and env variables for the
cinder-volume container.

This is likely going to be needed by some Cinder backends who may not
have in-tree TripleO integration yet and need these types of
customizations.

Change-Id: I825c5373c7c4ab6896579eae705bc034f67fb68f
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Cinder containers: volume and env customizations

This patch will allow custom volume and env variables for the
cinder-volume container.

This is likely going to be needed by some Cinder backends who may not
have in-tree TripleO integration yet and need these types of
customizations.

Change-Id: I825c5373c7c4ab6896579eae705bc034f67fb68f

commit_message:
look for .rst files in git as well as .html

Almost all of the built HTML pages will have come from a .rst file, so
we need to change the extension of the source path and look for that
version before falling back to using stat to get the timestamp.

Change-Id: I2035492255f5cca58fed220ce1aff0381fd10746
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
convert "trunk" to "latest" in URLs

Zuul calls the master branch "trunk" but we publish to URLs with
"latest" so we need to convert the name.

Change-Id: I306d9b04c977e0393d9a7b473c12fc9b9f889d28
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Run emit-job-header on any host but localhost
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-23 23:40:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Run emit-job-header on any host but localhost

We found out that emit-job-header can't actually run on localhost [1]
because some variables aren't set up there.
Therefore, we want to make sure this runs on any host *except*
localhost.

This is joined with a patch to ensure that emit-job-header only runs
once [2] in order to make sure we're not printing the header four times
if there's four nodes.

[1]: I8ef6c6778201b75e198c9a120242690573c320c6
[2]: Id9117935d9c53268ea893796154af03db21ee3a7

commit_message:
Run emit-job-header on any host but localhost

We found out that emit-job-header can't actually run on localhost [1]
because some variables aren't set up there.
Therefore, we want to make sure this runs on any host *except*
localhost.

This is joined with a patch to ensure that emit-job-header only runs
once [2] in order to make sure we're not printing the header four times
if there's four nodes.

[1]: I8ef6c6778201b75e198c9a120242690573c320c6
[2]: Id9117935d9c53268ea893796154af03db21ee3a7

Change-Id: Ia292df080e9715cf0e14cb21801046b41b2c7eb9

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-09 15:08:10.000000000', 'files': ['specs/approved/implement-rescue-mode.rst'], 'message': "Update 'Nova rescue/unrescue in Ironic'

make it explicit that only instance can be deleted when node

", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Update 'Nova rescue/unrescue in Ironic'

This updates the spec for outstanding comment for commit
82f79a54e08194cd14744a0c7913dcb58b16e50e. Update is made to
make it explicit that only instance can be deleted when node
is in RESCUEWAIT, RESCUE, UNRESCUEFAIL or RESCUEFAIL state.

Change-Id: I7c140edb53ed0ffe678a101f84df3fa3a3690b00

subject: look for liaison using team.lower()
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-15 16:27:08.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_releases/governance.py'], 'message': 'look for liaison using team.lower()

The wiki module normalizes the team names in the table by converting
them to lower case. Do the same when we look up the team to ensure we
find teams with mixed or upper case names in the wiki page.

Change-Id: I09c0ce4051b84084e2a3b7a186ec9e6efb10cdf0
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
look for liaison using team.lower()

The wiki module normalizes the team names in the table by converting
them to lower case. Do the same when we look up the team to ensure we
find teams with mixed or upper case names in the wiki page.

Change-Id: I09c0ce4051b84084e2a3b7a186ec9e6efb10cdf0
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Remove virtualenv-tools in the examples.
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-15 14:27:07.000000000', 'files': ['defaults/main.yml'], 'message': "Remove virtualenv-tools in the examples.

We shouldn't use virtualenv-tools, and it shouldn't appear
in our documentation.

Change-Id: I168e400ab8176bc94e48822284441368d8e73441
Partial-Bug: #1741634
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove virtualenv-tools in the examples.

We shouldn't use virtualenv-tools, and it shouldn't appear
in our documentation.

Change-Id: I168e400ab8176bc94e48822284441368d8e73441
Partial-Bug: #1741634

subject: Fixed the test name of ec2api tempest tests
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-15 11:26:46.000000000', 'files': ['run_tests.sh'], 'message': "Fixed the test name of ec2api tempest tests

* Due to tempest plugin split goal, the test path
  ec2api.tests.functional is moved to ec2api_tempest_plugin
  in new repo. Since python-ec2api-tempest-plugin is packaged in
  RDO, let's consume it.
* https://review.rdoproject.org/r/11292

Change-Id: Iab207122705cb91de57f852520101f6b35b4cbca
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fixed the test name of ec2api tempest tests

* Due to tempest plugin split goal, the test path
  ec2api.tests.functional is moved to ec2api_tempest_plugin
  in new repo. Since python-ec2api-tempest-plugin is packaged in
  RDO, let's consume it.
* https://review.rdoproject.org/r/11292

Change-Id: Iab207122705cb91de57f852520101f6b35b4cbca

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-15 08:06:48.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/logging.pp', 'releasenotes/notes/add-use_journal-option-for-logging-9f95c7513816de6f.yaml', 'spec/classes/octavia_logging_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Add use_journal option for logging configuration

commit_message:
Add use_journal option for logging configuration

This enables oslo.log to pass logging records to journald.

Change-Id: Iaa8d36d4622f6b58885a8c82ac04fa489fd2ba5b

commit_message:
console: introduce framework for RFB authentication

Introduce a framework for providing RFB authentication scheme
implementations. This will be later used by the websocket RFB security
proxy code.

Change-Id: I98403ca922b83a460a4e7baa12bd5f596a79c940
Co-authored-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Implements: bp websocket-proxy-to-host-security

subject: Add release highlights for Rocky
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-18 17:55:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add release highlights for Rocky

subject: Fix attrs list of LabeledInput.render() method
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-15 14:11:14.000000000', 'files': ['sahara_dashboard/content/data_processing/jobs/job_binaries/forms.py'], 'message': "Fix attrs list of LabeledInput.render() method

The item (and the buttom to create a new job binary) didn't work anymore
in Django 1.11, due to a change in the parameter list of the render()
method: it was previously based on the position, now the arguments are
explicitly passed using their names.

Thanks to https://github.com/springload/wagtaildraftail/issues/51
for the explanation.

Closes-Bug: #1743384
Change-Id: I241021c593ad50591f0155dfb364afbc662a4794
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix attrs list of LabeledInput.render() method

The item (and the buttom to create a new job binary) didn't work anymore
in Django 1.11, due to a change in the parameter list of the render()
method: it was previously based on the position, now the arguments are
explicitly passed using their names.

Thanks to https://github.com/springload/wagtaildraftail/issues/51
for the explanation.

Closes-Bug: #1743384
Change-Id: I241021c593ad50591f0155dfb364afbc662a4794

commit_message:
Use systemd module instead of command

This causes linters to break: since ansible 2.4 the systemd
module can have only the daemon_reload directive.

Change-Id: I66b041ebb22cba1abd92d5d0d36f206971ab555b

despite the volume swap failure). Instead, just abort the volume swap if
the guest is not active.

commit_message:
Do not attempt volume swap when guest is stopped/suspended

A swap on a stopped or suspended instance will fail silently. Remove
these allowed instance states on swap_volume:

suspended, stopped, soft_deleted

Change-Id: Iff17f7cee7a56037b35d1a361a0b3279d0a885d6
Closes-Bug: #1673090

commit_message:
novaclient: queens release 10.0.0

This is the first but probably not the last release
for python-novaclient in the queens series. We still
have a few changes up for review for new microversion
support that we'd like to get in before queens feature
freeze, but we should get a release out now to make sure
it plays well with other services in the ecosystem.

Depends-On: I60490f3d74212bb172dccc1c7d337198e1021236

Change-Id: Ie402bae6bab0012d4faed342eaa7c6a0011b86e9

commit_message:
Ingress: Move to namespaced ingress controllers and edge VIP

This PS moves to namespace specific ingress controllers, and a
cluster wide ingress controller that acts as the external front
door to the cluster. The cluster ingress controller will also
be able to create a dummy interface that can be announced via the
OpenStack-Helm-Infra Calico chart.

The ability to exercise the edge VIP feature is currently only
demonstrated in the single node gate and guide, as it requires
additional configuration, or hardware to set up the routes in
a multinode env.

Change-Id: I8b823b93465f2e90aaabcca9ec9b783d34539e07

commit_message:
Prevent exporting unbound variable

In some of jobs variables can be not available, so don't export
them if they are not defined. This happens in periodic jobs which
don't have ZUUL_CHANGES defined.

Change-Id: Ic406599e2838fdffb6bdb2ccf40d2169c4474771

[{'created': '2017-12-19 16:28:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'WIP Make sure haproxy config for redis uses on-marked-down shutdown-sessions

Change-Id: Ia4d8c27057ee2de9e49e4358aa069571d1c952a9
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2018-01-09 09:37:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Use on-marked-down shutdown-sessions for redis haproxy conf

The problem we have with redis can be described as follows:
- Connection is made to redis via haproxy, where haproxy directs to one redis node
- That chosen redis node fails and a new redis node gets promoted
- HAProxy will send *new* connections to redis to the newly promoted
  redis server, but you still have a session active (ie. that has not hit
  timeout), so haproxy will attempt to use that connection.

By using 'on-marked-down shutdown-sessions' we make sure we close
old existing sessions when the redis master node changes.

Closes-Bug: #1742086
Tested-By: Marian Krcmarik <mkrcmari@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ia4d8c27057ee2de9e49e4358aa069571d1c952a9
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2018-01-11 15:40:25.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/haproxy.pp'], 'message': "Use on-marked-down shutdown-sessions for redis haproxy conf

The problem we have with redis can be described as follows:
- Connection is made to redis via haproxy, where haproxy directs to one redis node
- That chosen redis node fails and a new redis node gets promoted
- HAProxy will send *new* connections to redis to the newly promoted
  redis server, but you still have a session active (ie. that has not hit
  timeout), so haproxy will attempt to use that connection.

By using 'on-marked-down shutdown-sessions' we make sure we close
old existing sessions when the redis master node changes.

Closes-Bug: #1742086

Change-Id: Ia4d8c27057ee2de9e49e4358aa069571d1c952a9
", 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
Use on-marked-down shutdown-sessions for redis haproxy conf

The problem we have with redis can be described as follows:
- Connection is made to redis via haproxy, where haproxy directs to one redis node
- That chosen redis node fails and a new redis node gets promoted
- HAProxy will send *new* connections to redis to the newly promoted
  redis server, but you still have a session active (ie. that has not hit
  timeout), so haproxy will attempt to use that connection.

By using 'on-marked-down shutdown-sessions' we make sure we close
old existing sessions when the redis master node changes.

Closes-Bug: #1742086
Tested-By: Marian Krcmarik <mkrcmari@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ia4d8c27057ee2de9e49e4358aa069571d1c952a9

commit_message:
Change stable repos layout

* Download TripleO packages from their "current" (e.g. current-pike)
* Download all the rest from their promoted repos (current-tripleo).

It's not realistic to deploy TripleO projects from the latest tag
promoted, some fixes have been merged in the meantime, not released and
promoted (chichen and egg, can't be released if not merged) so we really
need to deploy the TripleO projects from current.

Example: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/533380/ doesn't pass because
it's testing an old version of puppet-tripleo that doesn't contain the
fixes that we need to land https://review.openstack.org/#/c/533380/ and
fix scenario001 (voting in gate).

Therefore, let's deploy the TripleO projects from current and not from
their latest promoted version.

Change-Id: If4920c9971005ea65c1b4db11312339072ee6be9

subject: improve output messages
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-14 15:17:22.000000000', 'files': ['reno/config.py', 'reno/scanner.py', 'reno/main.py'], 'message': "improve output messages

Change the order of initialization so the logging module is configured
before the configuration file is read. This lets us log debug messages
from the config module.

Add some information from the config module about which configuration
file is loaded, and in verbose mode which files we're looking for.

Add some information to the scanner output to show whether
collapse_pre_releases is set to true.

Change-Id: Ia78bc63e2c29de2ac8771b46397a63639012bb90
Addresses-Bug: #1743202
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
improve output messages

Change the order of initialization so the logging module is configured
before the configuration file is read. This lets us log debug messages
from the config module.

Add some information from the config module about which configuration
file is loaded, and in verbose mode which files we're looking for.

Add some information to the scanner output to show whether
collapse_pre_releases is set to true.

Change-Id: Ia78bc63e2c29de2ac8771b46397a63639012bb90
Addresses-Bug: #1743202
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
ovs-lib: Pass string as udp port to ovsdb

ovsdb maps accept strings as values only. This patch converts integer to
be passed to ovsdb in case vxlan_udp_port config value is used.

Change-Id: Idba77939a80d80a4bc9625d10c8b37b23b91b9c5
Closes-bug: #1742931

commit_message:
Add aggregates check in allocation candidates

Allocation candidates api returned some wrong
combinations of non-sharing resource provider and
shared resource provider, ignoring aggregates.

This patch adds aggregate check when constructing
shared allocation request being aware of non-sharing
resource in _shared_allocation_request_resources.

Change-Id: Ib45fde56706a861df0fc048bbec8a568fd26d85d
Closes-Bug:#1732707

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-09 22:25:17.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/services/trunk/rpc/server.py', 'neutron/services/trunk/plugin.py'], 'message': 'Revert "Use writer for trunk database operations"

This reverts commit bd9e6467d70744dea624387ef2435de658ec6611.

Since trunk plugin uses OVO objects that still use the old engine
facade, and as we learnt in bug 1706750, old and new facades don't
cooperate, we risk some objects being committed to database before
writer.using __exit__s, or even when writer.using fails with an
exception, because old facade will commit changes to database right
after its session.begin context manager __exit__s.

Reverting the switch to new facade for trunk plugin until we figure out
how to switch OVO layer to the new facade.

Partially-Implements: blueprint enginefacade-switch
Change-Id: I2918c15f6c9ea71b1e51797e5ba9c835505579e0
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Revert "Use writer for trunk database operations"

This reverts commit bd9e6467d70744dea624387ef2435de658ec6611.

Since trunk plugin uses OVO objects that still use the old engine
facade, and as we learnt in bug 1706750, old and new facades don't
cooperate, we risk some objects being committed to database before
writer.using __exit__s, or even when writer.using fails with an
exception, because old facade will commit changes to database right
after its session.begin context manager __exit__s.

Reverting the switch to new facade for trunk plugin until we figure out
how to switch OVO layer to the new facade.

Partially-Implements: blueprint enginefacade-switch
Change-Id: I2918c15f6c9ea71b1e51797e5ba9c835505579e0

subject: Set password for mysql root user on undercloud
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-11 12:38:11.000000000', 'files': ['undercloud.conf.sample', 'instack_undercloud/undercloud.py', 'elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.yaml.template'], 'message': "Set password for mysql root user on undercloud

The port is firewalled off by default so mysql is not reachable except
to localhost users. In any case it is good to set a password for the
mysql root user.

We are 'reusing' the user_db_password parameter, because it is actually
unused, instead of adding yet another parameter.

Tested this change against an existing undercloud and observed that
the mysql root user got a correct password and that the /root/.my.cnf
file got generated.

Closes-Bug: #1742191

Change-Id: I408ce3a0fe2ab8e86bcc280256cdb51688efde75
(cherry picked from commit 955c339af3ddf040fab4a153f1e6c249aefe0989)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Set password for mysql root user on undercloud

The port is firewalled off by default so mysql is not reachable except
to localhost users. In any case it is good to set a password for the
mysql root user.

We are 'reusing' the user_db_password parameter, because it is actually
unused, instead of adding yet another parameter.

Tested this change against an existing undercloud and observed that
the mysql root user got a correct password and that the /root/.my.cnf
file got generated.

Closes-Bug: #1742191

Change-Id: I408ce3a0fe2ab8e86bcc280256cdb51688efde75
(cherry picked from commit 955c339af3ddf040fab4a153f1e6c249aefe0989)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-04 20:20:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'libvirt: Attach and detach encryptors during swap_volume

Previously no attempt was made to attach encryptors to a target volume
during swap_volume leading to Libvirt rebasing data from the original
encrypted volume onto the RAW underlying target volume.

This would leave unencrypted data on the volume but would also result in
the loss of this data with any future attempts to reattach encryptors to
the volume.

This change avoids this by correctly calling for encryptor attachment
and detachment during swap_volume. The request context is also provided
to allow for the lookup of the relevant encryption metadata.

Closes-bug: #1739593
Change-Id: I31c5909d3ed8216a801d59e33d15ad58b1cebce8

commit_message:
libvirt: Attach and detach encryptors during swap_volume

Previously no attempt was made to attach encryptors to a target volume
during swap_volume leading to Libvirt rebasing data from the original
encrypted volume onto the RAW underlying target volume.

This would leave unencrypted data on the volume but would also result in
the loss of this data with any future attempts to reattach encryptors to
the volume.

This change avoids this by correctly calling for encryptor attachment
and detachment during swap_volume. The request context is also provided
to allow lookups of the relevant encryption metadata.

Closes-bug: #1739593
Change-Id: I31c5909d3ed8216a801d59e33d15ad58b1cebce8

commit_message:
ensure pipeline_listener set up

unit tests occasionally fail because it seems like the
pipeline_listener has yet to be configured yet. this waits to ensure
both the group_state is set and the pipeline_listener is set
before doing anything.

Change-Id: I5af31d34e2f1f8fa3d198f9d58be5beca7984d65
(cherry picked from commit e158ca010368a05a22e554188f641c3a76060f61)

commit_message:
Add factory helper function which returns a singleton

Not that ServiceTypes is super expensive or anything, but it's also
an encapsultation of static data, so there's really no need to construct
more than one of them in a program.

Change-Id: I2515fd9be27421006ed22a3ab01bef8cb48196f8

[{'created': '2018-01-11 12:56:48.000000000', 'files': ['workbooks/fernet-key-rotate.yaml'], 'message': 'Always pass the plan name to fernet workbook

It was using the default (overcloud) which is not necessarily the case
for every deployment.

This commit passes the TRIPLEO_PLAN_NAME environment file and derives

Closes-Bug: #1742655

commit_message:
Always pass the plan name to fernet workbook

It was using the default (overcloud) which is not necessarily the case
for every deployment.

This commit passes the TRIPLEO_PLAN_NAME environment file and derives
the value from the passed container name.

Change-Id: I2fc481336b945c88f8b6a017690773be3293a2b4
Closes-Bug: #1742655

Adds a NodeTrait model to the DB and API methods for the following:

* Set/unset node traits
* Get node traits
* Add/remove a single trait
* Check for existence of a node trait

All node traits are deleted when their owner node is deleted. Traits
cannot be specified on node creation currently.

commit_message:
Node traits: Add DB API & model

Adds a NodeTrait model to the DB and DBAPI methods for the following:

* Set/unset node traits
* Get node traits
* Add/remove a single trait
* Check for existence of a node trait

All node traits are deleted when their owner node is deleted. Traits
cannot be specified on node creation currently.

Change-Id: I8b375a33dcb94d2cc73eaa93a5cc5aed86c27178
Partial-Bug: #1722194

commit_message:
Merge repeat code for rebalance

There are three similar code segments in rebalance process as follows：

    tiers = ['cluster', 'regions', 'zones', 'servers', 'devices']
    for i, tier_name in enumerate(tiers):
        replicas_at_tier = sum(weighted_replicas_by_tier[t] for t in
                               weighted_replicas_by_tier if len(t) == i)
        if abs(self.replicas - replicas_at_tier) > 1e-10:
            raise exceptions.RingValidationError(
                '%s != %s at tier %s' % (
                    replicas_at_tier, self.replicas, tier_name))

I think we can encapsulate this code segment to a private function and
replace those code segments with a function call

Change-Id: I89439286b211f2c5ef19deffa77c202f48f07cf8

commit_message:
Add docs for reloading workbooks during development

Prior to I2d3576d30fcae74ea692bd712a40264004d9b9d1 I used to copy
this from instack-undercloud, but since that now uses python it's
useful to have a reference of how to update all workbooks after
installing a locally built tripleo-common package.

Change-Id: I0eb53bcb63d3c8722d787f1f4a389a854860a623

revisions:

virtualenv-tools has a bug which gets triggered in gates: it can't
change the shebang of a virtualenv python bin/ files if they
were generated with a virtualenv script whose shebang ends with
python2 instead of python.

Because we can't modify virtualenv-tools, we use shell scripts
instead.

change the shebang of a virtualenv python bin/ files if they
were generated with a virtualenv script whose shebang ends with

Partial-Bug: #1741634

commit_message:
Replace virtualenv-tools by a script

virtualenv-tools has a bug which gets triggered in gates: it can't
change the shebang of a virtualenv python bin/ files if they
were generated with a virtualenv script whose shebang ends with
python2 instead of python.

Because we can't modify virtualenv-tools, we use shell scripts
instead.

Change-Id: I75f189b7e8856f6ec4e844ca8fdf2c8c81fb3faa
Partial-Bug: #1741634

commit_message:
simplify gnocchi batch push setup

we run through samples and format samples and resources to what
gnocchi expects. this simplifies that process a little:
- don't needlessly sort and group by metric name
- build a full resource model iff resource needs to be created

Change-Id: I2ac25b3b0978eed664c500e645bae2d1b4ae6781

commit_message:
Add release notes template and improve format

Adds a new template from which release notes will be created.
This allows us to maintain a structred format for future
release notes. Also makes some changes to the way release
notes are formatted to ensure clarity.

Change-Id: I489f44bf214dc0bf47e486f9969f428d8618de40

ensure it is correctly overloaded.

Change-Id: Ifc6c8510f70e9336fbf626db8bbacf206ad0d08c

commit_message:
broken HybridIptablesHelper function override

When creating the hybrid firewall helper class the
_remove_conntrack_entries_from_port_deleted function is
overloaded, when overloaded it does not have a "self" parameter
and fails when it's called by the neutron agent.

This patch adds in the self parameter and adds a test to
ensure it is correctly overloaded.

Related-bug: 1721895

Change-Id: Ifc6c8510f70e9336fbf626db8bbacf206ad0d08c

commit_message:
Use NbApi where possible in df_db

dragonflow/cli/df_db.py uses db driver directly all over the file.
It should instead use NbApi: `NbApi.get_instance(False)` and convert
all the direct calls to db driver (Where possible).

This change also performs a little refactoring on df-db to make
it a bit more compact, and reduce code duplication.

Change-Id: Id2b04aec0bd325c411b16639dc5061e24e677351
Closes-Bug: #1698653

commit_message:
bagpipe driver: add support for Port Associations

Add support to bagpipe driver for producing OVO RPC pushes
on API operations on Port Associations.

(The actual implementation for supporting Port Associations
in bagpipe is done in networking-bagpipe.)

Partially-Implements: blueprint routes-control
Depends-On: I70df12228df0a98b8fbe8bae0a7af77edf408c50

Change-Id: I3b58506ffa03eb32399d7da4f8fd4cc3be425756

commit_message:
Remove call to sys.exc_clear() in Python 3

This method has been removed in Python 3.
The exception state is clear outside the 'Except' clause.

Change-Id: Iaf3e482ec46488b65f5ce180ba067057c981b72c
Signed-off-by: Vitalii Solodilov <mcdkr@yandex.ru>

[{'created': '2017-10-09 12:23:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix Aodh's health checks (pike backport)

HAProxy currently checks aodh backend with "HEAD /" and an expected
return code of 401. The request actually returns "200 OK". The 401 would
be returned if the check would target "HEAD /v2", but as all other
backends that do not implement "/healthcheck" also check "HEAD /" for
2xx/3xx return codes, I removed the wrongly expected "401".

Closes-Bug: 1719875

commit_message:
Fix Aodh's health checks (pike backport)

HAProxy currently checks aodh backend with "HEAD /" and an expected
return code of 401. The request actually returns "200 OK". The 401 would
be returned if the check would target "HEAD /v2", but as all other
backends that do not implement "/healthcheck" also check "HEAD /" for
2xx/3xx return codes, I removed the wrongly expected "401".

Change-Id: If20216c605938c14a94d9b710d3f98b0d885b629
Closes-Bug: 1719875

subject: Re-introduce shard range updates to root after shard has sharded
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-03 11:17:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Re-introduce shard range updates to root after shard has sharded

... but not when shrinking.

This restores some previously commented lines, with new conditions
applied.

When cleaving shard ranges, their object stats may have changed since
being found, so update the shard ranges after cleaving. This is an
optimisation to get timely stats updates, but not strictly necessary,
because once replicated the cleaved shards will independently start to
update the root container.

However, when shrinking, do not update the acceptor shard range with
the cleaved broker stats because the cleaved broker will only
contain a subset of the existing acceptor's objects.

When a shard has been completely sharded, send updated shard ranges to
the root container - again, this is an optimisation to get timely
updates to the root.

commit_message:
Re-introduce shard range updates to root after shard has sharded

...but don't update their stats when shrinking.

When cleaving shard ranges, their object stats may have changed since
being found, so the shard range stats are updated after cleaving. This
is an optimisation to get timely stats updates, but not strictly
necessary, because once replicated the cleaved shards will
independently start to update the root container.

However, when shrinking, the acceptor shard range should not be
updated with the cleaved broker stats because the cleaved broker will
only contain a subset of the existing acceptor's objects.

When a shard has been completely sharded, send updated shard ranges to
the root container - again, this is an optimisation to get timely
updates to the root.

Change-Id: Ic7d6ea0fea70caf2a37382164cbd460e8b5ec1bd

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-09 14:05:07.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/common/constants.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/iptables_firewall.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_iptables_firewall.py'], 'message': "Fix error when using protocol number in security groups

When the support of protocol numbers in security groups
was fixed in [1], it introduced two deficiencies in the
iptables code:

- it was missing some protocols, for example, 'icmp', 'tcp'
  and 'udp', so when rules were added by number we did not
  use their name as iptables expects
- it used a dictionary to map numbers to names, but protocol
  numbers are stored as strings (i.e. '1' != 1)

Updated the iptables number mapping dict to have all
currently-known values, even those that are already well-known
and should have been using a string instead of a number.

Also changed the iptables number mapping dict to use
strings as the keys instead of numbers, since that's
what will be passed from the security group code.

Removed IPTABLES_PROTOCOL_MAP as it lives in neutron-lib,
and accidentally snuck-in in [1].

[1] I5895250b47ddf664d214cf085be693c3897e0c87

Change-Id: I6b7575eb531b4f35579960c3feb47000cd259b86
Closes-Bug: 1719711
(cherry picked from commit 37bd42e4f5d1be49689032822aca339523cfda33)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix error when using protocol number in security groups

When the support of protocol numbers in security groups
was fixed in [1], it introduced two deficiencies in the
iptables code:

- it was missing some protocols, for example, 'icmp', 'tcp'
  and 'udp', so when rules were added by number we did not
  use their name as iptables expects
- it used a dictionary to map numbers to names, but protocol
  numbers are stored as strings (i.e. '1' != 1)

Updated the iptables number mapping dict to have all
currently-known values, even those that are already well-known
and should have been using a string instead of a number.

Also changed the iptables number mapping dict to use
strings as the keys instead of numbers, since that's
what will be passed from the security group code.

Removed IPTABLES_PROTOCOL_MAP as it lives in neutron-lib,
and accidentally snuck-in in [1].

[1] I5895250b47ddf664d214cf085be693c3897e0c87

Change-Id: I6b7575eb531b4f35579960c3feb47000cd259b86
Closes-Bug: 1719711
(cherry picked from commit 37bd42e4f5d1be49689032822aca339523cfda33)

commit_message:
Wait for server to be active in test_device_tagging

In test_device_tagging, we should wait for server to be
active before getting ssh_client. This testcase doesn't
fail in ci because it uses validation.connect_method = floating,
which will wait for server to be active if validatable=True
is passed in.

Besides, before get_server_ip we should call show_server,
otherwise 'addresses' is not present in the result of create_server
and so we will get:
File "/tempest/api/compute/base.py", line 387, in get_server_ip
    addresses = server['addresses'][CONF.validation.network_for_ssh]
    KeyError: 'addresses'

Change-Id: I70410c47394310795064cd9fde0b9b47ddd00982

subject: Disallow x-delete-at equal to x-timestamp
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 597, 'name': 'Pete Zaitcev', 'email': 'zaitcev@kotori.zaitcev.us', 'username': 'zaitcev'}, {'_account_id': 1179, 'name': 'Clay Gerrard', 'email': 'clay.gerrard@gmail.com', 'username': 'clay-gerrard'}, {'_account_id': 2622, 'name': 'Samuel Merritt', 'email': 'sam@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'torgomatic'}, {'_account_id': 7233, 'name': 'Matthew Oliver', 'email': 'matt@oliver.net.au', 'username': 'mattoliverau'}, {'_account_id': 7847, 'name': 'Alistair Coles', 'email': 'alistairncoles@gmail.com', 'username': 'acoles'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15343, 'name': 'Tim Burke', 'email': 'tburke@nvidia.com', 'username': 'tburke'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-08 10:29:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Disallow x-delete-at equal to x-timestamp

Previously an x-delete-at value equal to the x-timestamp value is
allowed.  This could only occur when x-timestamp happened to take an
integer value and would result in an object that was immediately
unreadable.

Similarly an x-delete-after value of zero may previously have been
accepted if x-timestamp happened to be an integer value.

With this change an x-delete-at value equal to x-timestamp or an
x-delete-after value of zero always results in a 400 BadRequest.

Also cleans up check_delete_headers docstring.

commit_message:
Disallow x-delete-at equal to x-timestamp

Previously an x-delete-at value equal to the x-timestamp value was
allowed.  This could only occur when x-timestamp happened to take an
integer value and would result in an object that was immediately
unreadable.

Similarly an x-delete-after value of zero may previously have been
accepted if x-timestamp happened to be an integer value.

With this change an x-delete-at value equal to x-timestamp or an
x-delete-after value of zero always results in a 400 BadRequest.

Also cleans up check_delete_headers docstring.

Related-Change: Ia8d00fcef8893e3b3dd5720da2c8a5ae1e6e4cb8
Related-Change: Ib2483444d3999e13ba83ca2edd3a8ef8e5c48548
Change-Id: I27fdd800d8e149302ff4d6531101e9726a14d471

commit_message:
console: introduce the VeNCrypt RFB authentication scheme

Provide an implementation for the VeNCrypt RFB authentication
scheme, which uses TLS and x509 certificates to provide both
encryption and mutual authentication / authorization.

Based on earlier work by Solly Ross <sross@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I6a63d2535e86faf369ed1c0eeba6cb5a52252b80
Co-authored-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Implements: bp websocket-proxy-to-host-security

commit_message:
Check for ports correctness

This patch is updating networking-ovn to check for correctness when
creating, updating or deleting ports.

It does:

* Create the deltas using the information stored in OVNNB instead of
original_port parameter

* Save the revision number from Neutron in the ovn_revision_number table
and in OVNDB

* Expand the maintenance periodic task to detect and fix inconsistencies
for ports

Note that DNS records still can get out of sync but should be fixed by
https://bugs.launchpad.net/networking-ovn/+bug/1739257

Partial-Bug: #1605089
Change-Id: I1b2366743d76e93c8a2b19c06bcba10a3a29c7f6

In case a node is only set to run the kubelet, there's not going to be a

commit_message:
devstack: don't assume there's a running hyperkube

In case a node is only set to run the kubelet, there's not going to be a
running hyperkube container and the hyperkube extraction will fail. It's
better to not assume and just have a cheap container run made in purpose
for extraction.

Change-Id: Iaa543825e89ae4acd2d4527f6eb4324b97874313
Closes-Bug: 1742757
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>

commit_message:
Remove usage of deprecated idlutils module

This module located in neutron.agent.ovsdb.native.idlutils is
deprecated and used only in functional test of ovs_lib module.
Now it's removed and proper module ovsdbapp.backend.ovs_idl.idlutils
is used instead.

commit_message:
Fix Python3 get_python_exec_prefix on Fedora 27

On Fedora 27, the default Pytho 3 install prefix changed from /usr
to /usr/local:
https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Changes/Making_sudo_pip_safe

Closes-Bug: #1741901
Change-Id: Id40620efdf173189df053b5d380a801092933f83

subject: Fix override of stage dir that affects stage-output
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-15 12:18:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix override of stage dir that affects stage-output

There seems to be unnecessary duplicity on logs_root and stage_dir. As
both variables will point to the same folder. The problem is that when
stage_dir is overriden that also affects stage-output and thus files end
up being copied to this newly defined dir (ie: /opt/stack) instead of
`{ansible_user_dir}` which is from where `fetch-devstack-log-dir`
fetches from.

This patch removes the override of `stage_dir` and adjust paths
accordingly. By doing so the result will be effectively the same in
regards as to this play, however now logs should be properly staged and
later copied in the devstack post play.

Change-Id: I0d0397e3c2b2f16f271f49f567ddba7c4033764d
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2018-01-15 12:50:47.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/post-tempest.yaml'], 'message': 'Fix override of stage dir that affects stage-output

There seems to be unnecessary duplicity on logs_root and stage_dir. As
both variables will point to the same folder. The problem is that when
stage_dir is overriden that also affects stage-output and thus files end
up being copied to this newly defined dir (ie: /opt/stack) instead of
`{ansible_user_dir}` which is from where `fetch-devstack-log-dir`
fetches from.

This patch removes the override of `stage_dir` and adjust paths
accordingly. By doing so the result will be effectively the same in
regards as to this play, however now logs should be properly staged and

Change-Id: I0d0397e3c2b2f16f271f49f567ddba7c4033764d
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Fix override of stage dir that affects stage-output

There seems to be unnecessary duplicity on logs_root and stage_dir. As
both variables will point to the same folder. The problem is that when
stage_dir is overriden that also affects stage-output and thus files end
up being copied to this newly defined dir (ie: /opt/stack) instead of
`{ansible_user_dir}` which is from where `fetch-devstack-log-dir`
fetches from.

This patch removes the override of `stage_dir` and adjust paths
accordingly. By doing so the result will be effectively the same in
regards as to this play, however now logs should be properly staged and
later copied in the devstack post play.

Change-Id: I0d0397e3c2b2f16f271f49f567ddba7c4033764d

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-01-12 20:59:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': '[WIP] Add network_qos_policy_id to port info

Port can use QoS policy attached directly to it but it also
can inherit policy attached to network. This patch adds
field "network_qos_policy_id" to port fields to show users
what QoS policy attached to network is affecting current port.

It is only kind of PoC for now. I'm not sure if it is even
going in good direction.

Change-Id: Ibd3a614a33f057e14f35f5eecad9fd80b0ba2c2c
Closes-Bug: #1649517

', 'number': 13}, {'created': '2017-07-04 10:45:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add network_qos_policy_id to port info

Port can use QoS policy attached directly to it but it also
can inherit policy attached to network. This patch adds
field "network_qos_policy_id" to port fields to show users
what QoS policy attached to network is affecting current port.

DocImpact
Ports created on a network also inherit the network's QoS policies,
which will now be displayed with the port's QoS policies.

Co-Authored-By: Reedip <reedip14@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ibd3a614a33f057e14f35f5eecad9fd80b0ba2c2c
Closes-Bug: #1649517

commit_message:
Add network_qos_policy_id to port info

Port can use QoS policy attached directly to it but it also
can inherit policy attached to network. This patch adds
field "network_qos_policy_id" to port fields to show users
what QoS policy attached to network is affecting current port.

APIImpact

Co-Authored-By: Reedip <reedip14@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ibd3a614a33f057e14f35f5eecad9fd80b0ba2c2c
Closes-Bug: #1649517

commit_message:
Add receipes for mariadb cluster deployment

After removal of the percona cluster receipes, add support for deploying
a galera-based mariadb cluster instead.

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-27 08:02:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "ops-database refactor for Pike and Chef 13

- implemented foodcritic and cookstyle corrections
- deprecated node.foo.bar method access for node['foo']['bar'] bracket access
- removed deprecated postgresql support
- removed percona-cluster as the Percona cookbook has not been touched since 2015

This change was largely born out of a discussion in #sous-chefs on the Chef
Community Slack. The notion of using the vendor-provided package is preferred
in the Chef Community versus the distro version if possible, due to
inconsistencies in outcome. As a result, this cookbook focuses on MariaDB, and
specifically from mariadb.org.

Implements blueprint modern-chef

Change-Id: I7ee0f5eae4e79e5c70ee8de4a0094a7c34fdd18f

commit_message:
ops-database refactor for Pike and Chef 13

- implemented foodcritic and cookstyle corrections
- deprecated node.foo.bar method access for node['foo']['bar'] bracket syntax
- removed deprecated postgresql support
- removed percona-cluster as the Percona cookbook has not been touched since 2015
- switched default rdbms to mariadb[0]

This change was largely born out of a discussion in #sous-chefs on the Chef
Community Slack. The notion of using the vendor-provided package is preferred
in the Chef Community versus the distro version if possible, due to
inconsistencies in outcome. As a result, this cookbook focuses on MariaDB, and
specifically from mariadb.org.

[0]: https://docs.openstack.org/install-guide/environment-sql-database.html

Implements blueprint modern-chef

Change-Id: I7ee0f5eae4e79e5c70ee8de4a0094a7c34fdd18f

commit_message:
Moved gnocchi tempest tests under telemetry tempest plugin

* In order to achieve tempest plugin split goal, we have merged
  aodh, panko, ceilometer and gnocchi tempest plugin into
  telemetry tempest plugin

* gnocchi/tempest -> telemetry_tempest_plugin/gnocchi
* gnocchi/tests/functional_live -> telemetry_tempest_plugin/gnocchi

Change-Id: Icf6789afc143db3206af409c62a36e56edefd142

commit_message:
Add etcd_volume_size handling for CoreOS/kubernetes driver

Without those fixes new cluster fails with message:
ERROR: The Parameter (etcd_volume_size) was not defined in template.

Removed duplicated jobs

The devstack repo used twice the neutron-grenade job, remove one
version.

Similar with tempest (neutron-grenade) and neutron
(legacy-tempest-dsvm-neutron-pg-full). The duplication is an artifact
from the automatic generation of this file.

it's safe to release neutron-lib.

commit_message:
add neutron-lib master periodic job to vmware-nsx

We currently run the periodic-jobs-with-neutron-lib-master on a number
of sub-projects that consume neutron-lib. These periodics act as a
smokescreen to determine consumer health and is used to determine if
it's safe to release neutron-lib.

This patch adds vmware-nsx to that set of consumers by including the
periodic-jobs-with-neutron-lib-master template on the vmware-nsx
project. It also adds the periodic results to the neutron-lib
grafana dashboard.

Change-Id: Ic94010417fc702e2ebf62e29bb29c363af68d10c

commit_message:
Don't run legacy-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full on non-code nova changes

As of change I5d34e5b983b720dc1913d00ccc1a16d81a040d49 we are
running this job in stable branches for nova changes again, but
we need to ignore it for non-code changes like the other dsvm jobs.

Change-Id: Ib1e86f4d3b62b0ca7318e5ee1a192f880b8bba83

commit_message:
Capture logging while running tests

There is a great amount of logging while running tests because there is
no logging fixture to capture the log output, stderr and stdout. This
change enables the environmental variables that tell oslotest base to
apply those fixtures.

Change-Id: I7689201c6835f7b9ba8ea6e0af48df229482cae8

commit_message:
Move logs to backup locations

In addition to readme.txt file done in earlier patch, we move old
non-containerized service logs to backup directories, so that
operators don't look at them by mistake, thinking they are logs for
currently running services.

Change-Id: If8b3ef7d8b373dfeacf166a73fe5f9099e658e45
Partial-Bug: #1730957

commit_message:
Make tempest carbon voting again

Looking at the grafana [1] for this job, it seems the failure rate is
below 25% so I suggest we make it voting again, and focus on fixing the
breakages that are still there.

[1] http://grafana.openstack.org/dashboard/db/networking-odl-failure-rate

Change-Id: I4165361167151edb4ef815c49e5f20bf453bf5d5

commit_message:
Fixes babel-plugin-react-intl configuration

According to https://www.npmjs.com/package/babel-plugin-react-intl
moduleSourceName is used to indicate the name of react-intl package.

This commit removes configuration value ("./redux-form-validators")
which prevents babel-plugin-react-intl plugin from finding where
react-intl package is and does not generate "./i18n/extracted-messages"
folder from "npm run build" command.

Change-Id: I0481c50199fef8d9719a68e18383a709a493ab9a
Closes-Bug: #1737577
